sub_topic: Show that every group of order p^2, where p is a prime, is either cyclic or isomorphic to the direct product of two cyclic groups of order p.
message_1: A math student is asked to prove that there exists a unique group of order 7², up to isomorphism, determine whether this group is cyclic or isomorphic to the direct product of two cyclic groups of order 7, and justify their answer.
